DataElement.preferredName: Common Toxicity Criteria for Adverse Events Movement Disorder Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the movement disorder common toxicity criteria adverse event.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Common Toxicity Criteria for Adverse Events Movement Disorder
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event._Neurological conditions resulting in abnormal voluntary or involuntary movement, which may impact the speed, fluency, quality and ease of movement.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.

Concepts.longName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events
Concepts.definition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.

Property.preferredDefinition: Neurological conditions resulting in abnormal voluntary or involuntary movement, which may impact the speed, fluency, quality and ease of movement.

Concepts.definition: Neurological conditions resulting in abnormal voluntary or involuntary movement, which may impact the speed, fluency, quality and ease of movement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Neurological conditions resulting in abnormal voluntary or involuntary movement, which may impact the speed, fluency, quality and ease of movement._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A movement disorder characterized by involuntary and rhythmic shaking of a body part that is relaxed and not held against gravity, and where the tremor amplitude decreases with voluntary movements. Resting tremor is a common sign of Parkinson's disease.

Concepts.definition: A movement disorder characterized by involuntary and rhythmic shaking of a body part that is relaxed and not held against gravity, and where the tremor amplitude decreases with voluntary movements. Resting tremor is a common sign of Parkinson's disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A neurological disorder characterized by impairment of handwriting ability that may be associated with other learning disabilities in children or traumatic damage to the parietal lobe in adults.

Concepts.definition: A neurological disorder characterized by impairment of handwriting ability that may be associated with other learning disabilities in children or traumatic damage to the parietal lobe in adults.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Muscular rigidity that is characterized by jerky incremental movements of a limb when passively moved through the range of motion of a joint. Cogwheel rigidity is often an early sign of Parkinson's disease.

Concepts.definition: Muscular rigidity that is characterized by jerky incremental movements of a limb when passively moved through the range of motion of a joint. Cogwheel rigidity is often an early sign of Parkinson's disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A rapid, involuntary jerk of a muscle or group of muscles.

Concepts.definition: A rapid, involuntary jerk of a muscle or group of muscles.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding referring to walking difficulties.

Concepts.definition: A finding referring to walking difficulties.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lack of coordination of movement typified by the undershoot or overshoot of intended position with the hand, arm, leg, or eye.
Difficulty moving; distortion or impairment of voluntary movement, as in tic, spasm, or myoclonus.

Concepts.definition: Abnormality or impairment of voluntary movement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lack of coordination of muscle movements resulting in the impairment or inability to perform voluntary activities. Causes include peripheral nerve disorders, posterior column injuries, cerebral and cerebellar disorders, basal ganglia disorders, and thalamic disorders.

Concepts.definition: Lack of coordination of muscle movements resulting in the impairment or inability to perform voluntary activities. Causes include peripheral nerve disorders, posterior column injuries, cerebral and cerebellar disorders, basal ganglia disorders, and thalamic disorders.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Neurological conditions resulting in abnormal voluntary or involuntary movement, which may impact the speed, fluency, quality and ease of movement.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Neurological conditions resulting in abnormal voluntary or involuntary movement, which may impact the speed, fluency, quality and ease of movement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tremor that occurs with the voluntary movement of a muscle. Subcategories include postural, kinetic, and isometric tremors.

Concepts.definition: A tremor that occurs with the voluntary movement of a muscle. Subcategories include postural, kinetic, and isometric tremors.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The shaking movement of the whole body or just a certain part of it, often caused by problems of the neurons responsible for muscle action.

Concepts.definition: The shaking movement of the whole body or just a certain part of it, often caused by problems of the neurons responsible for muscle action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not characterized in any other way.

Concepts.definition: Not characterized in any other way.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Neurological conditions resulting in abnormal voluntary or involuntary movement, which may impact the speed, fluency, quality and ease of movement.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: Neurological conditions resulting in abnormal voluntary or involuntary movement, which may impact the speed, fluency, quality and ease of movement.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
